p: Stigma does not only produce discriminatory behavior and estrangement between family and friends [ 28] (therefore, crumbling the foundations of the social fabric), but it also spreads individual issues, such as the perception of a negative self-image [ 27]. Findings show that stigma affects large groups of population and takes various forms: stigmatized people are shunned, insulted, marginalized, and rejected in the domains of work, interpersonal relationships, use of services and schooling [ 15, 29].
